caption: One of the coolest spots in Brooklyn Heights.

this is one of the best, if not the best quick stop restaurants to go to in brooklyn!! the owner is very sweet and always prepares each meal or drink diligently. it definitely tastes delicious & is made right then despite some other places. the prices are also really cheap, a bargain for food so yummy! highly recommended!

I am by no means a reviewer (this is actually my first), but I am definitely a coffee drinker worth her salt.  What I found at Cefecito was a genuine slice of home.  I am from one of those families that chases three meals a day with stovetop espresso, it's woven into the meal experience, and often a source of comfort. It suffices to say that I go to a lot of cafes during the work week.  The difference here is that this cup resonates.  It's just damn good.  Encantada de tener un cafe verdaderamente autentico en el vecindario!  The cafe con leche is my go to, pro tip: splurge on the extra shot for the large.

Cortadito was excellent, well balanced flavor and sweetness. Andrew was very generous and provided me with some samples of his smoothies and pastries. Def recommend to stop by for some good coffee and quick bite!!!

It’s not authentic or even very good. I had to throw out my cafe con leche. The guy who runs it said to me he “feels Cuban” because he lived in Miami a number of years...as an actual Cuban who was born and raised in Miami, you can’t go around saying that without being able to back it up.
This place has the best Cuban coffees! Super convenient spot right off the 2/3 train.  The best breakfast is an iced cortadito and toasted cuban bread with butter.  Don't miss it
This is so good!! I'm picky as hell about my coffee. Definite QUALITY!!!!!!!!!!

Best tasting Cuban Coffee in Brooklyn. They have empanadas, guava pastries and Cuban sandwiches. This place is a true Gem! I love getting Cafe con Leche and toasted Cuban bread. I tried their Cuban Sandwich and it was AMAZING.
